symbols.name: sap.ui.fl
symbols.description: SAPUI5 library for UI Flexibility and Descriptor Changes and Descriptor Variants.

nodes.name: sap.ui.fl.ControlPersonalizationAPI
nodes.description: Provides an API to handle specific functionality for personalized changes.

symbols.title: namespace sap.ui.fl

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.ControlPersonalizationAPI
symbols.description: Provides an API to handle specific functionality for personalized changes.

methods.name: sap.ui.fl.ControlPersonalizationAPI.activateVariant

returnValue.description: Returns Promise that resolves after the variant is updated or rejects when an error occurs

parameters.name: vElement
parameters.description: The component or control (instance or ID) on which the variantModel is set

parameters.name: sVariantReference
parameters.description: The variant reference which needs to be activated

methods.description: Activates the passed variant applicable to the passed control/component.

methods.name: sap.ui.fl.ControlPersonalizationAPI.addPersonalizationChanges

returnValue.description: Returns Promise resolving to an array of successfully applied changes, after the changes have been written to the map of dirty changes and applied to the control

parameters.name: mPropertyBag
parameters.description: Changes along with other settings that need to be added

parameters.name: controlChanges
parameters.description: Array of control changes of type sap.ui.fl.ControlPersonalizationAPI.PersonalizationChange

parameters.name: ignoreVariantManagement
parameters.description: If flag is set to true then variant management will be ignored

methods.description: Creates personalization changes, adds them to the flex persistence (not yet saved) and applies them to the control.

methods.name: sap.ui.fl.ControlPersonalizationAPI.clearVariantParameterInURL

parameters.name: oVariantManagementControl
parameters.description: The variant management control for which the URL technical parameter has to be cleared

methods.description: Clears URL technical parameter 'sap-ui-fl-control-variant-id' for control variants. If a variant management control is given as parameter, only parameters specific to that control are cleared.

methods.name: sap.ui.fl.ControlPersonalizationAPI.hasVariantManagement

returnValue.description: Returns true if a variant management control is encompassing the given control, else false

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: The control which should be tested for an encompassing variant management control

methods.description: Determines the availability of an encompassing variant management control.

methods.name: sap.ui.fl.ControlPersonalizationAPI.isPersonalized

returnValue.description: Promise resolving with true if personalization changes exists, otherwise false.

parameters.name: aControls
parameters.description: an array of instances of controls, a map with control IDs including a app component or a mixture for which personalization exists

parameters.name: appComponent
parameters.description: Application component of the controls at runtime in case a map has been used

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the control in case a map has been used to specify the control

parameters.name: aChangeTypes
parameters.description: Types of changes that have existing personalization.

methods.description: Checks if personalization changes exists for control.

methods.name: sap.ui.fl.ControlPersonalizationAPI.resetChanges

returnValue.description: Promise that resolves after the deletion took place and changes are reverted

parameters.name: aControls
parameters.description: an array of instances of controls, a map with control IDs including a app component or a mixture for which the reset shall take place

parameters.name: appComponent
parameters.description: Application component of the controls at runtime in case a map has been used

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the control in case a map has been used to specify the control

parameters.name: aChangeTypes
parameters.description: Types of changes that shall be deleted

methods.description: Deletes changes recorded for control. Changes to be deleted can be filtered by specification of change type(s).

methods.name: sap.ui.fl.ControlPersonalizationAPI.saveChanges

returnValue.description: Returns Promise which is resolved when the passed array of changes have been saved

parameters.name: oManagedObject
parameters.description: A managed object instance which has an application component responsible, on which changes need to be saved

methods.description: Saves unsaved changes added to sap.ui.fl.ChangePersistence.

nodes.name: sap.ui.fl.ControlPersonalizationAPI.PersonalizationChange
nodes.description: Object containing attributes of a change, along with the control to which this change should be applied.

symbols.title: namespace sap.ui.fl.ControlPersonalizationAPI

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.ControlPersonalizationAPI.PersonalizationChange
symbols.description: Object containing attributes of a change, along with the control to which this change should be applied.

properties.description: The control object to be used as selector for the change

properties.name: changeSpecificData
properties.description: The map of change-specific data to perform a flex change

properties.description: The change type for which a change handler is registered

methods.name: sap.ui.fl.descriptorRelated.api.DescriptorInlineChangeFactory.create_app_addAnnotationsToOData

returnValue.description: resolving when creating the descriptor inline change was successful (without backend access)

parameters.name: dataSourceId
parameters.description: the id of the data source to be changed by adding annotations from annotations parameter

parameters.name: annotations
parameters.description: array with ids of data sources of type 'ODataAnnotation' that should be added to the data source to be changed

parameters.name: annotationsInsertPosition
parameters.description: position at which the annotations should be added to the annotations of the data source to be changed (BEGINNING/END, default BEGINNING)

parameters.name: dataSource
parameters.description: one or several data sources of type 'ODataAnnotation' which should be added, all need to be contained in the annotations parameter

methods.description: Creates an inline change of change type appdescr_app_addAnnotationsToOData

methods.name: sap.ui.fl.descriptorRelated.api.DescriptorInlineChangeFactory.createDescriptorInlineChange

returnValue.description: resolving when creating the descriptor inline change was successful (without backend access)

methods.description: Creates an inline change

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the id of the app variant/CDM app config id to be provided for a new app variant/CDM app config and for deleting a app variant/CDM app config

parameters.name: reference
parameters.description: the proposed referenced descriptor or app variant/CDM app config id (might be overwritten by the backend) to be provided when creating a new app variant/CDM app config

parameters.name: layer
parameters.description: the proposed layer (might be overwritten by the backend) when creating a new app variant/CDM app config

parameters.name: isAppVariantRoot
parameters.description: indicator whether this is an app variant, default is true

parameters.name: mFileContent
parameters.description: file content of the existing app variant/CDM app config to be provided if app variant/CDM app config shall be created from an existing

parameters.name: bDeletion
parameters.description: deletion indicator to be provided if app variant/CDM app config shall be deleted

parameters.name: XsrfToken
parameters.description: XSRF token which can be reused for back-end connectivity. If no XSRF token is passed, a new one will be fetched from back end.

constructor.description: Provides the connectivity to the LRep & UI5 Flexibility Services REST-routes

methods.name: sap.ui.fl.LrepConnector.attachSentRequest

parameters.name: fCallback
parameters.description: function called after all related promises are resolved

methods.description: Registers a callback for a sent request to the back end. The callback is only called once for each change. Each call is done with an object similar to the resolve of the promises containing a status of the response from the back end i.e. success, a response containing the change processed in this request

methods.name: create

returnValue.description: Returns the result from the request

parameters.name: oPayload
parameters.description: The content which is send to the server

methods.description: Creates a change or variant via REST call.

methods.name: deleteChange

returnValue.description: Returns the result from the request

methods.description: Delete a change or variant via REST call.

methods.name: deleteFile

returnValue.description: Returns the result from the request

parameters.name: sNamespace
parameters.description: The abap package goes here. It is needed to identify the change.

methods.description: Delete a file via REST call.

methods.name: sap.ui.fl.LrepConnector.detachSentRequest

parameters.name: fCallback
parameters.description: function called after all related promises are resolved

methods.description: Deregisters a callback for a sent request to the back end if the callback was registered

methods.name: getFileAttributes

returnValue.description: Returns the result from the request

parameters.name: sNamespace
parameters.description: The abap package goes here. It is needed to identify the change. Default LREP namespace is "localchange".

methods.description: Retrieves the file attributes for a given resource in the LREP.

methods.name: getStaticResource

returnValue.description: Returns the result from the request

parameters.name: sNamespace
parameters.description: The abap package goes here. It is needed to identify the change. Default LREP namespace is "localchange".

parameters.name: bIsRuntime
parameters.description: The stored file content is handed over to the lrep provider that can dynamically adjust the content to the runtime context (e.g. do text replacement to the users' logon language) before

methods.description: Authenticated access to a resource in the Lrep

methods.name: sap.ui.fl.LrepConnector.isFlexServiceAvailable

returnValue.description: Promise resolved with a boolean value of the availability status

methods.description: Gets the availability status of the flexibility service.

methods.name: listContent

returnValue.description: Returns the result from the request

parameters.name: sNamespace
parameters.description: The file namespace goes here. It is needed to identify the change.

methods.description: Retrieves the content for a given namespace and layer via REST call.

methods.name: loadChanges

returnValue.description: Returns a Promise with the changes (changes, contexts, optional messagebundle), componentClassName and etag value; in case modules are present the Promise is resolved after the module request is finished

parameters.name: oComponent
parameters.description: Contains component data needed for reading changes

parameters.name: mPropertyBag
parameters.description: Contains additional data needed for reading changes

parameters.name: layer
parameters.description: Layer up to which changes shall be read (excluding the specified layer)

parameters.name: appVersion
parameters.description: Version of application whose changes shall be read

parameters.name: flexModulesUrl
parameters.description: address to which the request for modules should be sent in case modules are present

parameters.name: isTrial
parameters.description: true if the system is a trial system

methods.description:
Loads the changes for the given component class name.

References:

  • sap.ui.core.Component

methods.name: loadSettings

returnValue.description: Returns a Promise with the flexibility settings content

methods.description: Loads flexibility settings.

methods.name: resetChanges

parameters.name: sAppVersion
parameters.description: version of the application for which the reset takes place

parameters.name: sGenerator
parameters.description: generator with which the changes were created

parameters.name: aSelectorIds
parameters.description: selector IDs of controls for which the reset should filter

parameters.name: aChangeTypes
parameters.description: change types of the changes which should be reset

methods.description: Resets changes via REST call; Filters by provided parameters like the application reference, its version, the generator of the changes, the change type or changes on specific controls by their selector IDs.

methods.name: send

returnValue.description: Returns a promise to the result of the request

parameters.name: sMethod
parameters.description: HTTP-method to be used by this request (default GET)

parameters.name: mOptions
parameters.description: Additional options which should be used in the request

methods.description: Send a request to the back end

methods.name: setRequestUrlPrefix

parameters.name: sRequestUrlPrefix
parameters.description: request URL prefix which must start with a (/) and must not end with a (/)

methods.description: Prefix for request URL can be set in exceptional cases when consumer needs to add a prefix to the URL

methods.name: update

returnValue.description: Returns the result from the request

parameters.name: oPayload
parameters.description: The content which is send to the server

methods.description: Update a change or variant via REST call.

methods.name: upsert

returnValue.description: Returns the result from the request

parameters.name: sNamespace
parameters.description: The abap package goes here. It is needed to identify the change.

parameters.name: sContent
parameters.description: File content to be saved as string

methods.description: Upserts a given change or variant via REST call.
methods.code: upsert(sNamespace, sName, sType, sLayer, sContent, sContentType, sChangelist) : Object

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.transport.TransportDialog
symbols.description: The Transport Dialog Control can be used to implement a value help for selecting an ABAP package and transport request. It is not a generic utility, but part of the Variantmanament and therefore cannot be used in any other application.

properties.name: hidePackage
properties.description: Flag indicating whether the selection of an ABAP package is to be hidden or not.

properties.name: lrepObject
properties.description: The LREP object for which as transport request has to be selected

parameters.name: Utils
parameters.description: a reference to the flexibility utilities implementation.

parameters.description: a reference to the transport service implementation.

parameters.description: a reference to the transport dialog implementation.

methods.name: _prepareChangesForTransport

returnValue.description: Returns a Promise which resolves without parameters

parameters.name: oTransportInfo
parameters.description: object containing the package name and the transport

parameters.name: aAppVariantDescriptors
parameters.description: array that includes all app variant descriptors

methods.description: Prepare all changes and assign them to an existing transport.

methods.name: checkTransportInfo

returnValue.description: returns true if transport info is complete

methods.description: Checks transport info object

methods.name: openTransportSelection

returnValue.description: promise that resolves

parameters.name: oChange
parameters.description: the change for which the transport information should be retrieved

methods.description: Opens the transport selection dialog

methods.name: selectTransport

parameters.name: oObjectInfo
parameters.description: the LREP object, which has the attributes name, name space, type, layer and package.

parameters.name: fOkay
parameters.description: call-back to be invoked when a transport request has successfully been selected.

parameters.name: fError
parameters.description: call-back to be invoked when an error occurred during selection of a transport request.

parameters.name: bCompactMode
parameters.description: flag indicating whether the transport dialog should be opened in compact mode.

methods.description: Selects a transport request for a given LREP object. First checks if the Adaptation Transport Organizer (ATO) is enabled If ATO is enabled and the layered repository object is in the CUSTOMER layer, the request 'ATO_NOTIFICATION' has to be used. This request triggers in the back end that the change is added to an ATO collection. If ATO is not enabled or LREP object not in CUSTOMER layer: If the LREP object is already assigned to an open transport request or the LREP object is assigned to a local ABAP package, no dialog to select a transport is started. Instead the success callback is invoked directly. The transport dialog is shown if a package or a transport request has still to be selected, so if more than one transport request is available for the current user and the LREP object is not locked in an open transport request.

methods.name: setTransports

returnValue.description: promise that resolves without parameters

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: object of the root control for the transport

methods.description: Sets the transports for all changes.

symbols.name: sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement
symbols.description:
The VariantManagement control can be used to manage variants.

Usage

You can use this control in most controls that are enabled for UI adaptation at runtime.

properties.name: editable
properties.description: Indicates that the control is in edit state. If set to false the footer of the views list will be hidden.

properties.name: inErrorState
properties.description: Indicates that the control is in error state. If set to true error message will be displayed whenever the variant is opened.

properties.name: manualVariantKey
properties.description:
If set totrue, the key for a vendor variant will be added manually.
Node:This flag is only used internally in the app variant scenarios.

properties.name: modelName
properties.description:
Determines the name of the model. The binding context will be defined by the current ID.

Note: In a UI adaptation scenario, this property is not used at all because the model name is $FlexVariants

properties.name: showExecuteOnSelection
properties.description: Indicates that Execute on Selection is visible in the Save Variant and the Manage Variants dialogs.

properties.name: showSetAsDefault
properties.description: Indicates that set as default is visible in the Save Variant and the Manage Variants dialogs.

properties.name: updateVariantInURL
properties.description:
Determines the intention of setting the current variant based on passed information.

Note: The VariantManagement control does not react in any way to this property.

associations.name: for
associations.description: Contains the controls, for which the variant management is responsible.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

constructor.description:

events.description: This event is fired when a new variant is selected.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement
symbols.docuLinkText: UI Adaptation at Runtime: Enable Your App

experimental.text: This class is experimental and provides only limited functionality. Also the API might be changed in future.

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: either the URL where to load the JSON from or a JS object

parameters.name: oFlexController
parameters.description: the FlexController instance for the component which uses the variant model

parameters.name: oAppComponent
parameters.description: Application component instance that is currently loading

parameters.name: bObserve
parameters.description: whether to observe the JSON data for property changes (experimental)

methods.name: checkDirtyStateForControlModels
methods.description: Checks if dirty changes exist for the current variant inside the passed variant management reference. If no dirty changes exist, it marks the associated 'modified' model property to false.

methods.name: sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantModel.extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantModel with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.ui.model.json.JSONModel.extend.

returnValue.description: The current variant reference

methods.description: Returns the current variant for a given variant management control

methods.name: sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantModel.getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantModel.

returnValue.description: Returns a promise which resolves when "manage" event is fired from the variant management control

methods.description: Opens the manage dialog. Returns a promise which resolves to changes made from the manage dialog, based on the parameters passed.

methods.name: setVariantProperties

returnValue.description: Returns the created change object or null if no change is created

parameters.name: variantReference
parameters.description: Variant Reference for which properties should be set

parameters.name: changeType
parameters.description: Change type due to which properties are being set

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: App New title value for "setTitle" change type

methods.description: Sets the passed properties on a variant for the passed variant management reference. Also adds or removes a change depending upon the parameters passed.

nodes.name: sap.ui.fl
nodes.description: SAPUI5 library for UI Flexibility and Descriptor Changes and Descriptor Variants.

nodes.name: sap.ui.fl.transport.TransportDialog
nodes.description: The Transport Dialog Control can be used to implement a value help for selecting an ABAP package and transport request. It is not a generic utility, but part of the Variantmanament and therefore cannot be used in any other application.

nodes.name: sap.ui.fl.variants.SwitchChanges
nodes.description: Returns the map with all changes to be reverted and applied when switching variants

nodes.name: sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement
nodes.description:
The VariantManagement control can be used to manage variants.

Usage

You can use this control in most controls that are enabled for UI adaptation at runtime.
